record.description: Professor George Van Biesbroeck of the University of Chicago's Yerkes Observatory obtained this first picture of the new trans-Neptunian planet discovered by the Lowell Observatory. The planet is indicated by the arrow. Delta Geminorum is a nearby star, at the right, and it is visible to the naked eye. The light of the planet is twenty-five thousand times fainter than that of the star.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Curling, attached caption, PR stamps. The "trans-Neptunian planet" was discovered in 1930 at Lowell Observatory. See http://www.sciencenews.org/20000325/timeline.asp and http://www.klx.com/clyde/nmsu.html
